meanings.definition: The spread of cancer cells from a primary tumor to other parts of the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that carcinomatosis occurs when cancer cells travel to different body areas.
meanings.sent2: Her advanced stage of carcinomatosis meant the cancer had spread extensively.
meanings.sent3: Despite its serious nature, the concept of carcinomatosis sounds like a science fiction plot.
meanings.sent4: The rapid spread of rumors in the small town was likened to the way carcinomatosis invades the body.
meanings.sent5: The image of carcinomatosis creeping through the body is both frightening and awe-inspiring.

meanings.definition: The presence of multiple cancerous growths in an organ or tissue.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon identified carcinomatosis in the patient's lungs, indicating multiple cancerous growths.
meanings.sent2: The biopsy results confirmed the presence of carcinomatosis in the affected area.
meanings.sent3: The idea of carcinomatosis in a single flower pot made the botanist chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The spread of negativity in the workplace was compared to the way carcinomatosis affects tissues.
meanings.sent5: The sight of carcinomatosis under the microscope was both fascinating and terrifying.
